characters: PLACE, OVER-50, DU PONT MASTER'S INVITATIONAL
I/E. MARK'S FORD STATION WAGON/ ARBY'S PARKING LOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARK SCHULTZ (27, 180 lbs., cauliflower ears) lifts a hum sized, leather WRESTLING DUMMY from the mat to stand in f of him. He performs a series of repetitive moves - hookin one arm under the dummy's arm, then the other; one side, other. Again and again. It looks almost as if he's dancin gently with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, very fast, Mark spins quickly around behind the dum grabs it in a bear hug, arches his back, lifts and SLAMS to the mat, landing on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS: Mark spinning, lifting and slamming the dummy first one way, then the other - first one hold, then anot SLAM. SLAM. SLAM. SLAM. SLAM - over and over and over aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark pulls his beat-up car into a space in the parking lo this nondescript, 1960s-era suburban brick-facade school. He's freshly showered, wears a short-sleeve dress shirt, on tie, slacks. He reaches behind the front seat and pull out a battered BROWN VINYL BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark waits alone in a chair he's much too big for, his br vinyl briefcase on his lap. A portrait of President Reaga hangs on the painted cinder block wall. A clock ticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's on stage. An audience of 4th, 5th and 6th graders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I do it? Why do I push myself to my limits - of pain, of exhaustion - every day of my life? Why do I wake up every morning and make the commitment? Why do I do it? 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students are open-mouthed - they have no idea what to make of him. Mark's not being willfully over-the-top with these kids. This is just what's on his mind. All the time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 13 months - if I train right, if I push myself - I'll be going to Seoul - that's a city in South Korea. Does anyone know why? Because that's where the Olympic games are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark reaches into the briefcase at his feet and pulls out RIBBON with a MEDAL dangling from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone know what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a couple of kids start to raise their hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olympic gold medal. I won it three years ago at the `84 Games in Los Angeles. My brother, Dave Schultz - my best friend, my older brother, my best friend - won one too, just 23 hours and 16 minutes before I did. That's unprecedented - two brothers winning at the same Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to win another one? Would you like me to win another gold medal - for us, for America? Would you like to see me and my big brother - Dave Schultz - both win gold medals? Who here wants to see the two brothers win again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. A couple of the kids tentatively raise their han The rest are completely frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we're going to give it absolutely everything we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCHOOL SECRETARY writes out a check as Mark stands in f of the desk, placing his medal back in his briefcase. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty... and... no one-hundreds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tears off the check and hands it to Mark. He takes th check, holds out to her a SIGNED 8x10 PHOTO of himself wi his arms raised, in a USA WRESTLING SINGLET just after winning his Olympic gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is for the trophy case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?... For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the trophy case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the trophies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an elementary school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mark holds out the photo, WE HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: FAST FOOD KID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Can I take your order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long-haired, greasy KID with the very beginnings of a mustache takes Mark's order. Mark looks up at the menu si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a # 4.

dialogues.speaker: FAST FOOD KID
dialogues.text: # 4. Anything to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Can I get extra meat on that?

dialogues.speaker: FAST FOOD KID
dialogues.text: 65 cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: FAST FOOD KID
dialogues.text: Extra meat costs extra. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it say that?

dialogues.speaker: FAST FOOD KID
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just know I'm supposed to charge extra for extra meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always get extra meat. Every time I come here.

dialogues.speaker: FAST FOOD KID
dialogues.text: It's extra for extra meat. They told me. 65 cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits in his car, eating his sandwich - no enjoyment, just fueling himself. His RADIO plays a commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE SCHULTZ (31, bearded, intelligent, 163 lbs., strong, fierce, but calm), Head Coach of U of W wrestling, stands the wrestling mat speaking VERY QUIETLY with 3 or 4 selec WRESTLERS from the team. We can't quite hear what Dave is saying to them, but we can sense immediately the reverenc and deep respect they have for Dave - one of the country' top wrestlers and great coaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene gives off the feeling one might have watching a horse whisperer with a small group of stallions. Whatever he's saying, they are calmed by him, pay absolute attenti will do whatever he asks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheaply built 70s-era structure, where Mark inhabits tw small rooms with a cheap kitchenette built into the wall one of them. A particle-board BOOKCASE houses a little SH of Mark's medals - and PHOTOS of him and Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark retrieves his briefcase from inside the garbage bag extracts his GOLD MEDAL. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He replaces it in the PLASTIC DISPLAY CASE on the top she next to the photo of him and Dave smiling with their gold medals around their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark dumps a package of TOP RAMEN NOODLES into boiling wa And another package. And another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits on his one metal FOLDING CHAIR, at his table, eating his bowl of noodles. Moths tap against the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, in just boxer shorts, crosses off another day on hi wall calendar. 427 days to Seoul. He looks around, then d to the floor and starts a monstrous number of push-ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark runs hard past warehouses and auto repair outlets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark runs through knee-high weeds dragging a CAR TIRE attached to a rope behind him. He reaches a hill and head straight up, dragging the tire all the way -

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Coach Teller? This is Mark Schultz--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ink-stained directory of Wisconsin Public Schools lies open on the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I won a freestyle wrestling gold medal at the `84 Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, the phone tucked against his shoulder, slips a BLAN TAPE into a cheap VCR. He slides a HAND-LABELED TAPE into second VCR, wired to the first. We can read the label: "T MARK SCHULTZ WRESTLING CLINIC." He starts making a copy.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'm arranging a clinic in your area next weekend, and I wanted to invite you and some of your wrestlers to join...

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: That's Dave, my brother. I wrestle at 180... No, he won't be there, just me... Okay - well, good luck with your season, coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen is a montage of highlights from Mark's care take downs, pins. He's an animal - powerful, aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes, there's a small fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, Mark wrestles Resit Karabajak, a Turkish wrestler, in his first round match at the `84 Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: A unique, character-building opportunity for young wrestlers.... Yes, a small fee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark throws Karabajak to the mat. Pins him. Walks away, a raised. Crowd cheers. Karabajak's on the mat, hurt. 7.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Dave's my brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen, Mark does a back flip.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Olympic Champion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark does a back flip.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Dave's my brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's holds the phone on his lap, just watching himself the screen, wrestling... winning... match after match...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's outside at the second floor railing of this two-st stucco building, looking out over the bleak landscape: a 11, an Auto-Zone. He eats a hard-boiled egg. He watches a pull into the lot below. Dave gets out, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave fills two mismatched glasses with tap water from the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far'd you run? Ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's on the tattered couch. He shrugs, though we should that he loves the fact that Dave is concerned about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than ten? Dragging weight the whole way? (Dave turns off the water) You're a sick fuck, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave turns to look at Mark, sitting in the bare living ro 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place is looking good, by the way. I like what you've done with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave notices the Public Schools Directory on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You setting up clinics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talked to some coaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave comes toward Mark, handing off a water glass, draggi the folding chair over to sit across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't have anything booked for Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a favor. This school called me months ago to do a gig but now I can't. Nancy's got a thing all day so I gotta watch the kids. You free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the bedroom, looks at the calendar. There's NOTHING WRITTEN DOWN for any of the days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Saturday or Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday could work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at the BACK OF HIS HAND, where he's written do name and phone number in MARKER. He grabs one of Mark's V labels and a pen and writes the information. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Vinson, Radnor High. I'll let him know you'll call tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peels off the label and slaps it on Mark's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mark. Please come back to the gym. You don't have to do anything with the team. Just train with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's just looking at his older brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you there. Stay focused on what's important. For both of us. Seoul's the goal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Beat. Then, Mark nods at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seoul's the goal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven HIGH SCHOOL BOYS plus a couple of PRE-TEENS, all in wrestling gear, sit on the mat in front of Mark. He seems manic, evangelical, not tuned into his audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minute you step on the mat, you are exactly who you are. You can't hide. You can't pretend you trained harder than you did, you want it more than you do. My brother Dave and me care about this more than we care about anything. The difference between the number one guy in the world and the number four guy is paper thin. The one who wins is the one who wants it more, who's willing to sacrifice, who can take the pain. I can take the pain. My brother Dave can take the pain. Can you take the pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blank looks from the teenage wrestlers. Mark gestures to table set up near the door, on which is his OPEN BRIEFCAS with a stack of TAPES. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talk about all this in my instructional videotape - which you can purchase at the end of the day for a nominal fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark exits the locker room in his wrestling gear, heading the MATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's in his wrestling gear, on the far side of the gym, talking with TWO MIDDLE-AGED MEN in blazers with USA WRESTLING INSIGNIA. Mark walks onto the mat, waits for hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and the two men see Mark, WAVE to him - but Mark pretends not to notice, busies himself loosening his wris hands, neck. Dave walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Fred Cole from USA Wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men walk up behind Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Mark, how you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sort of nods, but doesn't really respond.

dialogues.speaker: FRED COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat, then turns to Dave) All right, Dave. Let us know if we can count on you. We'll talk soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods. They walk away. Then Dave turns back to Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been calling me and hanging up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adjusting his knee brace) No. What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark doesn't answer, just stands looking at him. For seve seconds, they look at each other. Then, slowly at first:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to circle each other. We sense immediately the differences: Dave's hunched and not very muscular physiqu belies his quickness and enormous strength. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's defining characteristic is brute force. A weight c heavier than Dave, he can NEVER SEEM TO BEAT HIS OLDER BROTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestling becomes intense and violent - Mark's head s into Dave's nose, drawing BLOOD. This only energizes Dave who slams Mark to the mat - dripping blood onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS of the increasingly brutal match, ending wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave rides Mark, who's on his stomach, flattened and spla grappling for a hold. Mark glances up to SEE: The USA Wrestling men WATCHING from near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks away, gritting his teeth, but Dave's gotten hi hold. As Dave TURNS and slams the bigger Mark -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks out the window. Silence. They sit there, both bruised and bloodied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come by the house, have dinner with me and Nance and the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's still looking out the window. He speaks quietly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win a gold medal for them. And still. Nothing. No respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Gimme a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave reaches for his arm, and Mark folds automatically in his older brother, puts his head on his chest. Dave embra him for several long moments - it's like a father and his young child. Then Dave smacks him on the back of the neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same time tomorrow. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark nods, gets out of the car and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark presses PLAY on his answering machine. Hang-ups and TONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark examines his bruised face in the mirror, wiping away blood - some of it his, some his brother's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's at the refrigerator, cracking ice cube trays into plastic 7-11 shopping bag. The PHONE RINGS. He picks up -

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's voice is heard. It sounds like long distance.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: May I please speak with Mr. Mark Schultz?

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: It's Mark.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to call you at night, but Mr. du Pont was anxious that I get in touch with you.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: He asked that you please consider taking a day off from your training to come out to Foxcatcher Farms so you men can meet face to face.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Who do you work for again? 13.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: John E. du Pont of the du Pont family of Newtown Square, Pennsylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may also know of him in connection with his support of the Villanova wrestling program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont requested that I contact you to set up a meeting. He'd like to bring you out to Pennsylvania.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: If I may I'd like to make travel arrangements for you, Mr. Schultz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's holding the ice cube tray, alone in his dingy kitc

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Mr. Schultz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRANDON (20s, post-prep school, jacket/tie) waits for Mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Schultz, I'm Brandon. Welcome to Philadelphia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark watches out the clear Plexi as the Pennsylvania countryside spreads out below him. He and Brandon and the pilot (LARRY - 50s, aviator glasses, Air Cavalry patch on jacket) all wear RADIO MIC HEADSETS. 14.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (ON RADIO MIC)
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont would have flown you himself, but he was asked at the last minute for tactical assistance by the Newtown Square Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark has no idea what that means, but nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (ON RADIO MIC)
dialogues.text: He should be back at the estate by the time we get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry BANKS the plane steeply on Mark's side so Mark has unobstructed view of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY, (ON RADIO MIC)
dialogues.text: Valley Forge below you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They speed over the historic site - wide fields, the memo arch, wood fences, the old stone house.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDON, (ON RADIO MIC)
dialogues.text: The du Pont family's supplied American armed forces with gunpowder since the beginning. (as Larry heads south) Foxcatcher in three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MARE and FOAL run away as the helicopter descends towar the Big House - a huge Georgian brick home in the middle 800 acres of fields and woods and outbuildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandon leads Mark down a carpeted hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. It's at once grandly elegant and musty. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel free to look around the library. Mr. du Pont will be up shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuts the door behind him. Mark's never been in a room li this - oil paintings of du Pont ancestors; foxhounds, hor hunts. Leather-bound books share space with framed OLD ST and antique (and not so antique) PISTOLS. Framed PHOTOS o the same man (JOHN DU PONT - 50, thin, beak-nosed, blond- hair) with Presidents Ford, Nixon, Reagan... Henry Kissin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's standing, gazing at the photos, when the door open revealing JOHN DU PONT, a police-issue HOLSTER dangling f one hand. He stops and breathlessly regards Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're actually here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no idea what to say) They said it was the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont puts the holster onto a chair. Holds out his hand

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: John du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark Sch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I know who you are - I've watched your Olympic victory enough times to know exactly who you are, every inch of you. Please, put your bag down, make yourself comfortable, sit, make yourself at home -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (You quickly realize that du Pont can be voluble and charming, but the more time you spend with him, the more see what an effort this is for him - how essentially uncomfortable he is in his own skin.... Also, he just mig have snorted a tiny bit of coke before he came in.) 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits. Du Pont settles in, sits facing him - focused entirely on Mark. He speaks intimately, sincerely

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I watched the video of your Olympic run again last night. After you broke the arm of the Turk - after they disqualified you, handed you a loss - after they put an extra official on you to watch your holds - all of which were legal - after all that you rack up seven straight wins to take the medal. For your country. Thrilling. Thrilling. Inspiring. Take the gold medal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark can't recall when he's received this kind of attenti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I'm proud of that day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be. I'm proud of that day. I'm proud of you on that day. Your parents must be enormously proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) To be perfectly honest, we don't often talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont nods, hoping Mark might say more. When he doesn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell you how much I appreciate your coming here. I know it cuts into your training. I imagine that's every day for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strength training in the morning? Upper body regimen - muscle tone - building up the muscle tone - across the upper body. In the morning? 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well. I take the mornings on my own - as you said, strength training, endurance - then I meet up with my brother - you know Dave Schultz - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course, yes, I know him. I mean, not personally, but yes, of course, I do know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I meet up with him at the U-W gym, we work out whatever free time we can grab between team practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: University of Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you both coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark NODS vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And they provide you with everything you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment as du Pont watches Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you win this upcoming tournament -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Thank you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I'd like to help you win this upcoming tournament. It's a big one, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the world championship. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do it, Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark just looks at him, unsure what he's being asked.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply no other reason) I want to be the best in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be the best in the world. I want this country to be the best in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak frankly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark nods... of course.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm concerned. I'm concerned by what I see in these Unites States. Athletes labor to bring honor to America, and America fails to honor that labor. Fails to honor it and fails to support it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's staring at du Pont intently.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When did you win your first match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started kind of late - high school sophomore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont waits, listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was... well, truthfully, I was... kind of lost. And I got into it `cause my brother was wrestling. He convinced me to give it a try. I never told him this, but I was scared of losing in front of him. So of course my first match I get put up against a kid two years older. Dave was helping coach from my corner... and at the end, when the ref raised my hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there was my brother, he was running towards me - screaming - laughing - he lifted me up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stops - face flushed - tries to stop himself from getting CHOKED UP. After a few moments, he speaks quietly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always been his sport. He let me inside. I'm just lucky to be very very good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won that match. Not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont and Mark walk the last few steps of a huge lawn u an OLD FIELD HOUSE in the final stages of renovation. Du opens the door. They walk into a gleaming new GYM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four pristine WRESTLING MATS are spread out on the floor. Through a doorway on the far end we can glimpse a WEIGHT with new nautilus and stationary bikes and free weights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.S. Olympic Committee refuses to recognize that training for international competition is a full time job. Why is that? Why is that? (looks at Mark) I want you all to have a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS of the vast historic site - monuments and fences and stone house headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wish every American could come here and see for themselves. See the price of freedom. It's not free at all. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stands next to John on a ridge over the CEMETERY fie Du Pont's front leg is poised on a large rock, as if he's General surveying all that has been conquered. His black Mercury is parked nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sacrifices of the troops that first long winter remind me of what you athletes go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as they look out over the national park.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gratified my family could play a small part in the history here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then du Pont speaks, as much to Mark as to himself -

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can't choose the family we're born to. But we can make our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think of anyone I'd rather build a team with. (turns to Mark) You name your price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plane takes off on the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on Mark's face, looking at himself in the mirror Studying his own face. Then he erupts in a PRIMAL SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on the face of a SIX-YEAR OLD BOY, CRYING - terrified. ALEXANDER, Dave's son. He's mid-way up a tall tree and scared to go any higher. Dave is a couple of branches above him. He looks down at Alexander, patiently waiting for the boy to stop crying. Finally, ALEX stops. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. The boy nods. They climb higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark rides in the back of a cab. As he nears Dave's house SEE Nancy tapping a beer keg in the side yard. Dave and A sit in the TOP OF THE TREE, watching Mark arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of U of W wrestlers, coaches, wives, girlfriends, ki Dave's at the BBQ, carving a huge roast on a spit with a CARVING KNIFE. Mark's talking to him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 thousand a year. He said name your price and I said the highest price that came into my head. We'd get to hand-pick our own team, wrestlers we want to work with -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you gonna train with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - I mean... when I say we, I mean - you and me... could choose a team. Together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does du Pont get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as you meet him you'll understand. He sees what we're after. He cares about America - old family, basically paid for the Revolutionary War - he gets it. He wants to help us win, help restore our pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pride is fine. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not.... This country's pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave just looks at him, silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave - this is it. This is what we've wanted our whole lives - just to train - you and me - not to have to deal with USA Wrestling, or Harper and his corrupt university program - not to have to think about anybody else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy has wandered over, Danielle on her hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - What're you guys talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm speaking to my brother, that okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Dave share a glance. Then Nancy turns to walk a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always good to see you, Mark. (as she walks away) Please, eat our food, shit on our lawn. Enjoy yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brothers are silent for a long moment until she's gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off. Then, a bit desperate -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deer hunting on his farm's supposed to be amazing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave speaks gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a good thing going here. I got a contract. Nancy's happy, Alex likes his school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reality starts to hit Mark that he may be doing this alone, without his older brother. He's shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Worlds are sixty days away. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me your plan. Who you gonna train with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont's taking his money out of the Villanova program. They'll pull the plug on that. So. Dan Bane could come. I - I guess Dan Bane. (beat, then, very quietly) I don't know how to do this without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is "everything" -- but Mark just shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like an opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you could make something of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spot's always open for you if you decide to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave steps forward and holds out his arms -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats, little brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark steps into his brother's arms, folding into him, hea his chest, holding on for dear life. Nancy looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark packs his apartment - trashing just about everything tossing it in the dumpster - stuffing the few essentials his AMC GREMLIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark drives across Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark gets gas. The attendant - clearly a HIGH SCHOOL WRES - shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark pulls onto the estate grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark rings the doorbell. No answer. He goes to ring it ag and the door is opened by a UNIFORMED MAID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Mark Schultz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. That means nothing to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see John du Pont?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mr. du Pont expecting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well - not today exactly, but, yes. This week. Sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment, please. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime can I use the -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SHUTS the door, leaving him outside. He turns and loo out over the VAST LAWN of the estate. Far off, it's being mowed by a gardener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening the door) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk just a few feet and she gestures toward a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he? He's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The washroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floral wallpaper, gold fixtures and faucet. Mark pisses - mouth open, eyes half shut. He flushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at a dish holding little pastel horseshoes. Soap picks one up, smells it. Washes his hands - monstrous wit the tiny soap. He wipes his hands on his pants, avoiding neatly hung towelettes. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Beck will see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark doesn't know who Mr. Beck is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is let into a large third floor office with a big de wood filing cabinets, LAW BOOKS lining the bookshelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAN BECK (mid-forties, no-nonsense, suit and tie) rises behind the desk as Mark enters. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Mr. Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. So. Mark Schultz, correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens a folder, writing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark just looks at him. Beat. Then he nods.

dialogues.speaker: STAN BECK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right. Mark. I manage affairs for Mr. du Pont. Look after his interests. If you have a problem, you come to me. If Mr. Du Pont has a problem, I'll come to you. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about what you're doing here. I'd like to make sure we all understand each other. Does that sound like a good policy to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be a good policy. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I think so, too. First thing I can tell you is that Mr. du Pont is very happy he can help you with your goals. But I want to make sure you're aware of what's expected. It's not a free ride. In exchange for the guest house, the more than substantial salary, the privilege of training at Foxcatcher Farms, Mr. du Pont expects results. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you can appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That goes for every wrestler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've actually got suggestions for about half the roster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a creased, folded piece of paper from his pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other half?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been making phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a look at that when you've finished. All right. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan takes out a form, writes on it as Mark puts away lis

dialogues.speaker: STAN BECK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your age?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Education? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oklahoma University.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undergraduate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You graduated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you own any property?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your parents still married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old were you when they separated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been accused of a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR OPENS and John du Pont pokes his head in. Mark STANDS, relieved to see him finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont seems surprised to see Mark. He stays in the door waves slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Hello. You've arrived. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, I drove straight down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little odd that du Pont doesn't enter - he seems nervous. He looks at Stan. Stan hands him a sheet of pape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight's speech. All set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes the paper and glances at it. Then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're setting him up in the chalet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent bed. Firm mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for the lower back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And du Pont's gone, closing the door behind him. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we finish this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits.

dialogues.speaker: STAN BECK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you ever been sued?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever initiated a lawsuit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandon walks with Mark. They've come far, across the hug side yard - the Big House looks small behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark can see HORSE STABLES that let out onto a huge fence track with a grass infield. Stable hands are putting seve thoroughbred horses through their paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the horses) They're Mrs. du Pont's. We all just keep our distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the WOODS. Just inside the trees is THE CHALET European style wooden guest house that is now Mark's home

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realize he was married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont? He's not. Mrs. du Pont's his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandon lets Mark in the door, turns on the lights in the living room, in the kitchen, goes to the bedroom. It's decorated like a ski chalet. Brandon walks back from the bedroom, holding KEYS out to Mark-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utilities are paid for - gas, electric. Refrigerator's stocked for now, but in the future you're responsible for feeding yourself. Unless of course you get invited to the Big House for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, still standing in the entry-way, accepts the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone will bring your car around. Anything else you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he always lived with his mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont? I think so. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandon leaves. Mark stands still for a long time, gazing his new home - including some of the oddities, like the P BEAR SKIN RUG (with HEAD ON) which is draped over the sof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark (in tank-top undershirt) tapes up PHOTOS of himself Dave. The POLAR BEAR HEAD on the rug gazes blankly at him KNOCK on the living room window. It's John du Pont, who points toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark opens the door. John's standing on the little porch, wearing a tux, holding a BOOK and a SMALL BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont, I want to thank you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont holds up a finger. Mark STOPS. Du Pont whispers -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark listens, shakes his head. Du Pont holds up his finge again - and then we HEAR it: a faint HOOTING from the woo

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Barred owl -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Mark the small box he's holding. Inside is a ver small set of BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you spot one, you'll see with each hoot there's a white flash in his collar. His throat swells, and he reveals to you the lighter feathers he keeps hidden underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Mark the BOOK: "South Pacific Birds" by John Eleuthere du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's from ten years ago, but I thought you might find it interesting. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark seems genuinely touched and impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Do you want to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The fridge is full - you probably know better than me what's in there-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - No. You need your rest. You need to get started bright and early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont hold up his own set of binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - I had a wonderful night a few years back when I spotted all eight Northeast species. Right here on the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have - two months to the Worlds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even. 54 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the two men standing in the porch light. PRELAP the so of POUNDING FEET, getting louder and louder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Wrestling shoes running FAST in place on the gy mat. There are SIX SETS of feet in a wide circle. Team Foxcatcher is beginning to come together. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All six wrestlers, Mark included, drop to the mats for 10 fast push-ups and sit-ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers are: ROBERTO GARCIA, aka "GECKO" (21 years 105 pounds, Latino, as fast a talker as he is a wrestler) JIM ZEREGA - "JIMMY Z" (24, 114 lbs., blond Midwesterner) MATT POPPER (24, 149 lbs., East coast working class); BRU SPRINGER (27, also 149 lbs., half Asian); MARK SCHULTZ (1 lbs.); and DAN BANE (30, 198 lbs., strong and low-key, intelligent, from the West, like Mark.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers jump up - run in place incredibly fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcia and Zerega sprint to the end of the mats and back. Relay shuttles, each pair races, then the next pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popper and Springer have just run (probably for the twent time) - they're BENT OVER, sucking wind by the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont WALKS IN. He wears a sweatsuit, has a whistle aro his neck. He hovers a slight distance away, observing, seeming to want to be noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Dan take off, racing, as Garcia beats Zerega -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont stares at Garcia. As Dan and Mark race back, Dan notices du Pont -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont becomes at once an odd combination of a kid invit to join in and the actual boss and benefactor of this tea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Bane. How's that hamstring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming back. It's coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good to hear. Hamstring coming back. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking up to him) Sir, you need me for something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no. Later. Please. Continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, turns back) Pair up. On the mat. Up and down. Popper, Springer, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springer's dragging a bit, clearly wiped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spling Loll - must lay off the pohk flied lice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck me, Gecko. (as he comes onto the mat) And I'm fucking Filipino, dickhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six wrestlers are paired and spread out on the mats - each pair in the up-down position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all go to it - the top wrestler trying to get a hold secure enough to turn the other - and the down wrestler splayed on the mat, fending him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont hovers nearby, watching intently. We can sense hi fascination - his admiration for these athletes. Also, hi jealousy - how desperately he'd love to be part of this brotherhood.... He CLAPS, like a coach would....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward, not loud enough) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, freshly showered, walks across the yard from the fi house gym to the Big House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont's pouring himself a scotch and soda at the built- wall bar. Mark's in the SITTING AREA of this large office which gives the unmistakable impression of having been inspired by the Oval Office. (We should sense that this i not the first of these meetings.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get you anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In training. Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes over and sits. He's immediately hushed and serio

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Talk to me about Roberto Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gecko? Great wrestler. What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont sits there nodding. He's mulling something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a sense. Keep your eye on him. Let me know of anything suspicious. Subversive. Anti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anti-what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything at all. Phone calls. Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no idea what that means) I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont stands and goes over to a carved WOODEN EAGLE on of one of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see the artistry, the care, the craftsmanship that went into making this great American symbol? You see the face hidden among the feathers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks. He doesn't see it. But he NODS anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to exert the same care in crafting a world-class wrestling experience here at Foxcatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're we doing with Dave Schultz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to speak to him again. When's he coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Look. Dave's... he's got a good situation going up in Madison. He's... he doesn't want to uproot. The family. Just at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the present time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a world class competitor - a world class coach. We are building a world class team. He belongs here. Tell me what I have to offer him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont, I don't... you can't buy Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Du Pont's clearly not happy with this answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't... I didn't realize you wanted him to coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrestle and coach. We all coach each other. Support each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His tone suddenly turns bright and positive -

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me ask your opinion -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the desk, where there are several large DRAWIN of a proposed Foxcatcher logo: a RED FOX running. In some the fox runs one way, in some the other. Mark approaches. 37.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think? Right to left, or left to right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as Mark examines the designs intently. Then, fina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right to left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont looks at him, then back at the drawings. On the t of them - studying, contemplating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark RUNS hard through the woods - pushing himself - jump fallen branches, sprinting up hills. He reaches the edge the woods and stops, bent over, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the field, PRIZE HORSES are led out of the stables onto the grounds of the estate. Mark WATCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few wrestlers (Zerega, Popper and Dan Bane) emerge from woods behind Mark, running. Dan Bane leaves the other two

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch up with you all later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zerega and Popper jog off. Dan comes to stand next to Mar who has taken his little pair of BINOCULARS from the pock of his sweats and is looking through them. After a moment hands Dan the binoculars. Dan looks through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure that's John's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULARS POV: A VERY OLD WOMAN stands in front of her wheelchair, with the help of an attendant. When the horse reach her, she TOUCHES THEM LOVINGLY, tenderly stroking t faces, feeding them treats from her hands. She's complete at home with these animals, as they are with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave Schultz SLAMS his opponent to the mat. He's in TEAM uniform, and he's dominating. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont watches from the stands, transfixed. Then he glan over at: Mark. Off to the side, watching his brother wres Whether he's fascinated, jealous, rooting - we can't tell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark wrestles like an animal - aggressive, forceful and f Dave's in Mark's corner, coaching - focused, intense, and very tough on Mark - shouting instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On du Pont, watching from the stands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud. The TV is on. A few Team USA WRESTLERS watch the Fr Sports TV wrap-up of the day's matches. Danielle JUMPS on bed near the window, with Nancy watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... twois... quatro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy laughs. Dave wrestles with Alexander on the other b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont and Mark are outside the door. Mark holds a VIDEOTAPE. He KNOCKS. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave wrestling with Alex on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fireman's carry... to a half- nelson... to a chicken wing... Wait! A chicken wing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to gobble up Alex's arm, who SHRIEKS in delight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark knocks again. We HEAR Nancy's voice yell from inside "It's open!" Mark opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noisy, chaotic. The wrestlers glance over "Hey, Mark" "Wh up".... Mark's focused on Dave, who wrestles with Alex -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a scrambled-egg!... a feather- pluck!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's plucking Alex and Alex is cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come meet Mr. du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sweeps up Alex and throws him over his shoulder, carrying him to the door. He SHAKES du Pont's HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Dave Schultz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John du Pont. It's a pleasure to meet you in person finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him how excited you were to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Alex, that's my wife, Nancy, our daughter Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nance. John du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy waves from over near the window -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. Can I get you a drink -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. No. I need to be getting back. But, don't worry - we'll make a Foxcatcher out of you yet. (he laughs awkwardly) Until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's GONE. Beat. Dave shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I know what I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkey drumstick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws Alex on the bed and jumps on him. Alex SQUEALS. Mark heads for the TV across the room. Pops in his video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, check out the tape I have on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you this downblock -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cue it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the tape cues up, Mark glances at Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too difficult to come say hello to Mr. du Pont? 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said hello. (lights a CIGARETTE) I'm watching my kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's John du Pont. One of the most generous men in America. He's gonna save USA Wrestling. (re. cigarette) Can you not do that in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrestle tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my room, Mark. You don't have to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to get advice from my brother, get ready for the finals -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get ready -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start smoking - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can leave. Go to your own room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Your kids are in here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She BLOWS SMOKE at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the one frigging smoking. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window's open. Relax. Show me what you want me to look at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks around the room. At Alexander giggling on the at Danielle bouncing, Nancy BLOWING SMOKE RINGS. It's all much. He pulls out the videotape and WALKS OUT the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS: Final matches in progress, intense and bru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits, alone, head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faces in the crowd watching; strained faces of the wrestl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark Schultz and Alexander Nanev's names are put up on th board. FINALS  82 KILOS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont enters. Mark's alone on a corner bench, frozen, h in his hands. Silence. Du Pont is stiff, but gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Du Pont goes over to him, unsure what to do. Uncomfortable, he puts his hand on Mark's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mark. Dave just won. It's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's body starts to shake. Then, very quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to let you down. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the first time anyone has said anything like this du Pont. He has no idea how to respond. He woodenly pats Mark's shoulder, then takes his hand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.... I've watched you these past months... (long beat, then quietly) I can't imagine being let down by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stops shaking. Du Pont stands patiently beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA'S TIGHT ON Mark as he enters the arena. Mark walks directly onto the mat, straight to the center, faces off the Bulgarian, NANEV. CAMERA stays tight on Mark looking directly at Nanev, as the ref checks each of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHISTLE. The match begins. Intense and rough. Neither abl gain an edge. Dave coaches from Mark's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In between periods. Mark sits as Dave FANS him with a tow shouting instruction. Mark glances behind him: du Pont watches from the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Nanev wrestle the final seconds - Mark ahead by point. Nanev tries desperately to turn Mark, to gain any advantage. The whistle blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ref takes each of their hands. He RAISES Mark's. He t them around, raises Mark's hand again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark does a BACK FLIP. He trots over to the opposing coac shakes his hand. He trots to his corner where Dave - beam his arms open wide - embraces him. Mark hugs his brother quickly, then turns to LOOK OUT into the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SPOTS du Pont, who's coming down the steps toward the platform. Mark walks toward him. The enormity of what he' just accomplished STARTS TO HIT Mark. His face is red. He reaches du Pont, and from a step below him, THROWS HIS AR around him, clings to him. Mark starts to SOB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont holds him as he looks out toward the wrestling ma where Dave watches. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRELAP SOUND: The beginning "AAAAAH's" of David Bowie's "LET'S DANCE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "LET'S DANCE" blasts from the stereo. Team Foxcatcher wrestlers are huddled in a circle in the Trophy Room - shouting the "AAAAAAAH's" along with the thin white duke. Each holds a BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE, shaking it up as they s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the chords kick in, they POP THEIR CORKS - SPRAYING champagne on each other, shouting wildly. Then they all C the rest of their bottles. Du Pont is dancing around outs the circle, doing his best Euro-electronica moves, and drinking from his bottle (and it's not his first). The wrestlers DANCE. When du Pont finishes his bottle -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's clear it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures toward the center section of the enormous TRO CASE - the entirety of which is filled with horse-jumping fox-hunting medals, ribbons and plaques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the wrestlers open the glass doors and start taki down what's in there. A few of the others open more liquo

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother's idea of sport is riding a horse that's chasing a dog that's chasing a fox. I don't share her affection for horseflesh -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The center case is cleared out.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put `em up, boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang their wrestling medals, place in trophies and o awards - leaving the TOP FEW HOOKS EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark! Mark! Mark! Mark!... 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark hangs his OLYMPIC and WORLD CUP GOLDS on the top hoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont raises his bottle to Mark -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've brought honor to Team Foxcatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk toward him.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've brought honor to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLIPS on the wet floor and his feet fly up in front of him, landing him FLAT ON HIS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. Du Pont's lying there, shaking - is he crying? N one knows what exactly to do. Dan Bane approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, Coach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont starts LAUGHING out loud. Hugely relieved, Dan ho his hand out to him to help him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont takes Dan's hand and promptly pulls him to the ground... and... JUMPS on his back - WRESTLING with him. wrestlers, including Mark, go crazy, CHEERING him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan lets du Pont get the best of him... lets du Pont PIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers are cheering madly as du Pont stands with h arms raised. He makes as if he's about to do a back flip (like Mark), then sits and does a clumsy backwards somersault. Wild cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More drinks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his knees, fists in the air, head thrown back - TOTALLY EXULTANT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRELAP sound of a GUNSHOT -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS: The AMERICAN FLAG being raised; a hawk soa above the trees; Jean du Pont BRUSHES the horses in the b 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA picks up wrestlers running off their hangovers - Zerega, Popper, Springer, Mark. They pick up speed as the camera stays with them. WE HEAR more gunshots as they run through the grounds - the SHOTS get louder and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers run somewhat near the FIRING RANGE, where several members of the NEWTOWN POLICE DEPARTMENT, in unif are SHOOTING target practice with DU PONT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont wears a "Team Foxcatcher" zip SWEATJACKET - with honorary POLICE BADGE pinned to one breast. On the other breast are sewn the words: "Head Coach", and JOHN "EAGLE" PONT. He's about to SHOOT when the wrestlers pass by -

dialogues.speaker: WRESTLERS, (EXCEPT MARK)
dialogues.text: Johnny D! Bossman!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont, still holding his pistol, turns to watch them ru past. His expression seems oddly, entirely blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few wrestlers lift weights - the others are hanging out resting, talking. Du Pont wanders in, his target practice PISTOL dangling from the crook of his arm. A few guys not him, greet him CASUALLY, go back to what they were doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont FIRES a bullet through the roof. SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 321 days to Seoul, gentlemen. 321 days. Let's get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for Mark to join him.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a CHECK for $10,000.00 made out to Mark Schultz

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits at his desk, pistol stuck in his waistband. Mar sweaty, stands across the desk from him, holding the chec 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America doesn't respect you. Doesn't place any value on you at all. I reward accomplishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Call me John. Or Coach. Whichever you prefer. Maybe Eagle. Or Coach. Eagle is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're we doing with Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark carefully folds the check, avoiding du Pont's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You spoke to him again at the Worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, I did. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna happen. He got offered a contract extension at Wisconsin, Team USA wants him to train Olympic wrestlers next summer, he - it's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is clearly unhappy with this answer. He removes the from his waistband, places it on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in this team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Do you believe we deserve this country's best talent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I pay for results not only on the mat, but in recruiting the best of the best to Foxcatcher Farms. That's part of your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Mark looks shamed by this. 48.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's probably best. Dave intimidates you. You don't believe you can ever do better than your brother. Glass ceiling. Impossible for you to break through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like perhaps Mark believes this as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that's true? Because... all these years -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont stands suddenly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Well. You're the public face of Foxcatcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - What do you know about Masters League wrestling tournaments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh - well - not all that much -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Because I'm thinking of entering one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Mark nods -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: VIDEOTAPE image of Mark at the 1984 Olympics, h hand being raised by the ref... Mark raises both hands in air, glances slightly down, then out at the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image FREEZES, is rewound, plays again. At the moment Mark raises his arms and GLANCES DOWN, the image FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: This is the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furniture has been pushed to the walls in the huge fo dining room, and a large WHITE SCRIM has been erected at end. A FASHION PHOTOGRAPHER who could double as a member Devo, stands at a video monitor with du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears the singlet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and the gold medal -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and, of course, the gold medal. And a lot of oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's in a dressing area wearing his FOXCATCHER SINGLET Olympic gold. Two assistants stuff his crotch with a bit padding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of oil. Please. More oil. It defines the musculature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks to his spot in front of the scrim. The two assistants slather baby oil on his arms and chest and leg the photographer SHOWS him the pose on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're winning the gold medal. You're raising your arms in triumph. You're also feeling humility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont is hanging back, but staring intensely at Mark. M looks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You good with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wonderful. It's exactly what I needed from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer takes his place behind the camera as the assistants finish with the baby oil and clear away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! Now. Mark. You're winning the gold medal! And you are humbled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark raises his arms and glances down. FLASH. FLASH. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! And again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP TO: Du Pont, in his Foxcatcher sweatsuit, is now in front of the scrim with Mark (still in his singlet.) Mark starts to hug du Pont for a photo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you were below me by a couple of steps when you hugged me at the Worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you kneeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneeled now? On the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? It won't look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. You should kneel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark kneels in front of du Pont. Hugs him. FLASH. FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think you were crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and John, wearing TUXEDOS, board a large helicopter. It's cold out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and John are flown southwest toward Washington DC by Larry the pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a folded piece of paper from his jacket pocket hands it to Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandon and I prepared some remarks. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark takes the paper and reads it over. He looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous. You'll do great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's not so sure. Then he HEARS a SNIFF. He looks over du Pont: he's got a COCAINE BULLET in one nostril. Du Pon inhales, then OFFERS the bullet to Mark. Mark's frozen -

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? You've never done this? (Mark shakes his head) It helps put everything in perspective. Trust me.... Mark. It's just cocaine. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark takes the coke bullet, examines it for several momen then holds it to one nostril. He INHALES.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice. You brought the medals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Try the speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Eagle du Pont, highly respected ornithologist, author, world explorer, phil... phila...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philatelist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter nears the LIT UP city of WASHINGTON D.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARGE SIGN on an EASEL by the entrance reads: "CITIZENS' DEFENSE OF PATRIOTS FUND - 1st ANNUAL GALA AND AUCTION".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loads of tuxedoed Republicans and their wives or mistress mill about. Small talk, hearty laughter, awarding of defe contracts, gallons of martinis.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: That's the one! That's the one I need!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FINGER is jabbing at a military photograph of an M-113 ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIER (APC).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a corner of the reception. Du Pont stands with S Graham, looking at a set of PHOTOS. Mark's nearby, chewin vigorously on a straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, the Grand Old Party wants to help find you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graham calls over to the 3-star GENERAL in full dress uni who's chewing on a cigar and drinking gin with a Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, any of these models available?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which? We might have a couple of those left on the lot. (to du Pont) You gonna need financing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs. Du Pont smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I need is the gun turret. Don't send me one without that MK- 19 mounted on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I don't know there, son. Civilians don't usually get 40mm blowback grenade launchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, John du Pont is hardly your usual civilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General turns back to the Senator, grumbling -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to get him a 12-pack of live fucking grenades, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's on stage, at the podium, READING from his Brandon- prepared remarks with - shall we say - some vigor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... highly respected ornithologist, author, world explorer, phil... phila...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont watches from the wings, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philatelist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
