dialogues.text: Mark looks over at him blankly - he has no idea what du P just said.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Philatelist. (Mark just looks at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamp collector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamp collector, and former pentathlete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean, in the audience, in her wheelchair, almost imperceptibly shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Du Pont will be making his return to competitive sports in the over-50 category at the Masters' League du Pont Wrestling Invitational in Phoenix, Arizona this March.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scattered applause, though no one has any idea what he's talking about. Du Pont watches from the wings. Mark reads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so proud to introduce my mentor. He has the ability to look at me and see where I am in life. He knows how to motivate me. I feel his love for me as an athlete and as a human being. My mother and father were divorced when I was two years old. I spent a lifetime looking for a father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and I found one in the Golden, uh... the Gold Eagle of America - John du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause as du Pont strides onstage, hugs Mark. Du Pont turns, beaming (and a little hopped-up) to the audience -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark Schultz. Thank you, son. (waves to Jean in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mother. (to them all) The gold medal Mark won in 1984 was tarnished. Tarnished by Jimmy Carter. Tarnished by the unpatriotic acts of that democrat administration. He caused the entire Eastern bloc to boycott our Los Angeles Games. Mark will have an opportunity to shine up that medal at the World Championships in just a few short weeks. To prove his worth in front of the assembled nations of the globe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some time has passed. Lights are on in the windows of the Field House Gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark kneels on the mat with du Pont, holding him in the starting position. Mark is talking du Pont through the mo for an escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get the sense that this is not the first of these less

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont clumsily attempts the escape. Mark is incredibly gentle with him, even tender, easing him through the move 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's HAIR IS NOW CUT SHORT AND BLEACHED WHITE. He's in shorts - no shirt - on the phone. He's sipping a beer, walking around the living room -

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm good. Yeah.... All good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT with Dave in the U of W gym office, looking out a wrestling team night practice.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You working hard?

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah. No, I'm kind of giving myself a bit of a break right now. I'll ramp it up again as the trials come closer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: All right. How close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There a KNOCK on Mark's window. Mark looks over and sees Pont standing outside, an eager look on his face. He beck to Mark and moves TWO FINGERS as if cutting his own hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to du Pont) Just a sec...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: No, I wasn't - listen, I gotta run -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I just - I gotta run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Call me soon. 56.

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I will -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: - You're a tough man to track down -

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: - Yeah, well -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: - Call me -

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: - I will. I gotta roll -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowie's "China Girl" PLAYS through outdoor speakers. Mark crops du Pont's hair with an ELECTRIC CLIPPER. It's unseasonably warm out - Mark's in shorts and flip flops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men are drinking from bottles of champagne. Du Pont' drunk enough that his defenses are down. A vanity table i the veranda with a mirror and a bowl of COCAINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark finishes buzzing -- looks at du Pont's crew cut in t mirror. Du Pont seems melancholy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need some more talc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both reach over to the bowl of "talc", rub some on t gums -- then they each snort a line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah! I think you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done the training, you learned the moves. You're ready to rumble, boss. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mark. I appreciate this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was fourteen - my father had left us long before that - my best friend was Clifford Holt, our gardener's son. Then I found out Mother had been paying Cliff to be friends with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is moved, but doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to know you and I have come to this... friendship without any of that nonsense. Financial nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither mentions that du Pont is actually paying Mark. Silence. Mark struggles whether to admit something. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Dave's son, Alex, was born he had some problems with his lungs. It looked like he wasn't gonna live. I was sitting in the hospital waiting room, and all I could think was: Maybe it's better if he dies. Dave won't be distracted. We can get back to training together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is fine now and, you know, he's my nephew. I'm not proud I wanted him to die, but it's the truth. That's just the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta conquer your demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont stands up. Expressionless, he disappears through sliding glass doors into the house. Mark LOOKS OUT over t dark grounds of Foxcatcher. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Mark jumps out of his skin as a MACHINE GUN FIRES several rounds behind him. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he turns around, there's du Pont, a determined look his face, pointing a semi-automatic MACHINE GUN out into rolling landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conquer demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FIRES again, a short burst of bullets into the dark. D Pont fires again, a sustained volley into the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the gunfire) Yeahhhhh!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont ceases fire and looks out. He begins lowering the when it accidentally goes off, firing a few bullets into wood deck - though he doesn't seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE, save for the steady HUM of flight inside the cab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont's gazing out the window of this private jet; he's trying to be brave, but he's clearly terrified of the upcoming match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits next to du Pont, on the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between periods at the "Du Pont Masters Open and Collegia Invitational". Very few people in the Masters gym bleache Large posters of the oiled-up Mark on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through large OPEN DOORS, in the adjoining gym, a larger crowd cheers on a number of NCAA wrestlers. FRED COLE and another USA WRESTLING OFFICIAL look in from the other gym They SEE the posters of Mark on the walls, and they SEE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exhausted du Pont, in his Foxcatcher singlet, is slump in his chair, encouraging Mark to massage his shoulders. OBLIGES. Mark glances at the OPEN DOORS, notices Fred Col Self-conscious, he ignores Cole and focuses on John. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he gives you the slightest opening, you gotta shoot in on him. Be aggressive. Show him who's boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont nods wearily. He can barely move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final minute of the match. It's clearly RIGGED. The O WRESTLER is trying to let the exhausted du Pont get the b of him. Mark watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REF blows the end of match whistle. The wrestlers sta du Pont struggling to his feet. The ref takes each of the hands, and raises... du Pont's. He's "won".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont limps off the mat. He approaches Mark, THROWS his arms around him the way Mark hugged du Pont at the Worlds Mark glances toward the open doors to the other gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and an exhausted du Pont enter the locker room. Mark SEES, off in a corner, Brandon speaking quietly with the OTHER WRESTLER from du Pont's match. He watches Brandon H the other wrestler an ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter is on the lawn, blades slowing, shutting d

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've rearranged some of the horse ribbons, Mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is seated in front of his mother, next to a window i her third floor room. She's in her wheelchair, with the oxygen tubes in her nose, imperious as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Some of the older prizes in the trophy case.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To make room for Team Foxcatcher medals.... For the wrestling awards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Jean just looks at her son, not reacting.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Including this, Mother. Ha. Which I've actually just won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his WINNER'S PLAQUE out of a duffel bag, trying be casual, but seeming all the more like an eager 9 year- He holds it out for her. She doesn't take it, but leans forward slightly to read what's inscribed on it: "FIRST

dialogues.speaker: PLACE, OVER-50, DU PONT MASTER'S INVITATIONAL
dialogues.text: DU PONT." She sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which ribbons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which ribbons did you move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some of the older ones. From the case. From the Rosemont case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a look later to see exactly what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U's of Jean's ribbons in the case, horse photos, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the vast lawn, the gardener drives his mower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont, in Foxcatcher sweats, walks in. The gym is EMPTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and the team are watching a VIDEOTAPE Garcia has got of an early ULTIMATE FIGHTING MATCH. It's an American str fighter versus a huge Brazilian Jujutsu expert. The match brutal and bloody and the wrestlers watching are CLEARLY IT. Mark is lying on the couch - attentive, but quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's KNOCKING at the door, but the guys don't notice i Much LOUDER KNOCKING. Garcia opens the door. It's du Pont Mark RISES to greet him as Dan MUTES the video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Boss. How you doing? Any soreness from the match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went by the gym - it's almost noon - and there's no one in there. There is no one in there. In the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, exactly - we've got an intense workout scheduled this afternoon. Real intense one. So we're taking the morning to rest up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who precisely is in charge around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do we stand on Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Schultz. Your brother. When is he coming to Foxcatcher? 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Mark glances at the other guys.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need someone to take charge around here, someone to lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, seriously, I don't know how else to say it. It's not gonna happen. You can't buy Dave. It's just not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont SLAPS Mark. HARD. Across the face. SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark could destroy du Pont. He doesn't seem to even consi it. He just stands there, like a chastened schoolboy, his face reddening. Du Pont WALKS OUT past the muted UFC on T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once he's gone, no one speaks. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got bitch-slapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark turns to Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcia runs into the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stands at the sink STARING at his reflection as the mirror fogs over from the RUNNING SHOWER: bleached hair, side of his face is red where du Pont slapped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits on the edge of his bed. He's neatly dressed, hi wet hair brushed. His face shaved. He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks quickly across the vast lawn toward the Big Ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark enters the Big House through the rear office entranc No one's in the reception area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts up the stairs, two at a time. Stan Beck comes o of his office, meets him at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. How are things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont's not available right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, please. I need to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a very full schedule this afternoon. But I'll let him know you stopped by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more and more upset) Listen - I - something happened. There was a - misunderstanding. I think I did something wrong and I really need to talk to him about it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Mark, I hear you. But Mr. du Pont's away for the afternoon on business. He's simply not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: STAN BECK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're going to have to do this later. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's frozen, not knowing what to do, where to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRELAP: KNOCKING on a DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark awakens with a start to the sound of someone KNOCKIN the front door. He looks at the clock. It's 3 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark opens the door to find du Pont standing there, in hi SWEATS. He clearly hasn't been to bed. And it's clearly a artificial stimulant that's been keeping him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New moves. Wrestling moves. Need to try them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Mark forces the cobwebs from his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. Just... just give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and du Pont are down on the wrestling mat. Du Pont o top. He's both weirdly aggressive with Mark - trying to g him in various holds - and also, in the bizarre way he's pressing against Mark, quasi-sexual. Mark is BLANK-FACED. Just waiting for it to end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT of the Foxcatcher estate. In the distance, a HELICOPTER approaches, the rotors getting louder and loud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter has LANDED, the rotors still WHIRRING LOUD (We won't hear dialogue in the following sequence.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE and NANCY and the kids descend from the helicopter, GREETED warmly by the wrestling team. MARK IS ABSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont emerges from the Big House, trailed by Brandon. W SEE du Pont notice what a warm reception Dave gets from t team. He comes down the steps, greets Dave and the family

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Mark, who's at the very far end of the lawn, ju inside the ring of trees, WATCHING. His HEAD is COMPLETEL SHAVED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARK'S POV: Brandon and the team escort Nancy and the kid toward their new home. Du Pont and Dave ascend the Big Ho steps together. Du Pont puts his arm around Dave's should Far away, the Big House front door CLOSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door OPENS. Mark has opened it from the inside. He's looking out at: Dave, on his porch. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't seen you yet. I just want to make sure everything's okay. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm just concentrating. Trials are in 50 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Nancy and the kids are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You should stop in, say hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the brothers stand in the doorway looking at each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRELAP: the sound of a GUNSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deer STAGGERS. It's been hit by a rifle shot. It stumbl starts to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE onto Dave, holding his RIFLE. He's hunting with D Bane and TWO WRESTLERS we don't recognize (recruited by h in the few weeks he's been there.) Dave FIRES again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAR: opening of THE DOOBIE BROTHERS' "Listen to the Musi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOOMBOX plays The Doobie Brothers. The deer CARCASS han from a large tree. Dave SKINS it with a long knife. Dave' son, Alex, sits on the picnic table, watching. Danielle r around the yard with some of the other wrestlers' kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC in the background. The (now dozen or so) wrestlers their families are gathered around the picnic table, the the roasting deer on the SPIT over the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont is at the table. Mark stays very much ON THE PERIPHERY of the group. Dave's holding court at the table in front of a huge platter of venison steaks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this big match between an American and a Russian. The Russian is a monster, never lost, kills everybody with this hold called The Pretzel. So the American coach tells his wrestler, "Listen, whatever you do don't let this guy get you in The Pretzel or you're dead." Sure enough, match starts, the Russian gets him in The Pretzel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are smiles around the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach buries his head in his hands because he know's it's all over. Suddenly, he hears the crowd roar. When he looks up the Russian is flying through the air - he lands on his back, the American jumps him. Pins him. Boom. The match is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont is studying Dave intently, fascinated by the hold has on people - the attention he gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nobody's ever gotten out of The Pretzel," the coach says afterward, "How'd you do it?" "Well, Coach, I was just about to give up when I opened my eyes and there was this big hairy pair of balls right in front of my face. I had nothing to lose, so with my last ounce of strength I craned my neck and bit those babies as hard as I could."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach says, "And that did the trick?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Coach, you'd be surprised how motivated you get when you bite your own balls."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone CRACKS UP. Du Pont WATCHES, trying to discern wh makes this man so effortlessly magnetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then du Pont laughs loudest of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dozen wrestlers are spread out on the mats, in pairs, wrestling. Dave walks among them. He moves close to Sprin giving instruction. Du Pont, in sweats and a whistle, lur nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's off against the wall, putting on weightlifting glo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives you opportunity, jump on it. Hard. Drive him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at du Pont, surprised by the comment - that Jo actually behaving as if he's coaching. Dave looks at some the wrestlers, realizes this is the norm. He laughs, pats Pont on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the wrestlers) Okay. Okay. You heard the Head Coach. No mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks out of the wrestling room to the weight room. Du Pont is thrilled to be validated for a moment. Then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to du Pont) Would you give us a little room? Just stand over there for a sec... (turns to Springer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont obeys, SHUFFLES off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluidly, expertly, Dave talks and wrestles through a seri of moves with Springer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - when he grabs for your elbow, goes for head position - your hand on his wrist needs to come up immediately, suck his arm to your chest, right hook over the top for the headlock, take him down, drive him down -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont watches the master work for several moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - you see him commit you make him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont clearly has nothing to contribute. He claps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it up, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Largely ignored, he drifts off into the weight room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits on the LEG-PRESS, pressing an enormous amount o weight - repeatedly - straining, pushing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont enters. Mark tries to ignore him, continues to pr the huge stack of weights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's taking the reins. Leading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark finishes his set, stares straight ahead, catching hi breath.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got more in you than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark turns his gaze to du Pont. SILENCE. Du Pont walks ov behind him, starts massaging Mark's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got to dig deep. Find out what's inside. Discover what you're made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't do that. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont keeps massaging. Mark glances towards the wrestli room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conquer your demons, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Please. I'm asking you to not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is coming in the direction of the weight room. Mark STANDS and walks out of the gym. Du Pont turns and sees D come through the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on TV screen: Mark being taken down by a wrestler. The image pauses, plays again. And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits in front of the screen, watching this sequence, over and over. Dave walks in through the open door. Mark doesn't acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you take off so suddenly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to study up. Fix some weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been doing this since you left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Dave stands there as Mark keeps watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with you and John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seemed kind of upset in the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was talking to you about something and you seemed pretty upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was he saying to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You want me to leave you alone, I'll leave you alone. You decide you want to talk, you know where to find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks out. Mark keeps watching his videotape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont drives his black Mercury. He's wearing what looks like an antique Revolutionary War General's battle COAT o a Foxcatcher t-shirt. There are a couple of MUSKETS in th back seat, another COAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's got the hood of his car up. He's showing Alex how change the oil filter. Danielle picks flowers in the yard brings them to Nancy on the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont pulls up in his car, gets out with the car runnin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Schultz. Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks around the open hood. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to show you something. Why don't you hop in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than a little odd that du Pont hasn't acknowled anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Need to show you something. At the battlefield. Come. Sit. Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Coach? It's Sunday. Family time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont stands there as if he hasn't quite registered wha Dave said. Beat. Beat. Nancy calls out from the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont looks over at her as if he's just noticed her presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family time. Ah. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, gets back in his car.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. Good family time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives off. Dave looks at Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark RUNS - alone, pushing himself, sprinting - through t woods, jumping rocks and fallen tree trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers train on the mats. Du Pont patrols the perimeter, REPEATEDLY LOOKING TOWARD the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont SEES someone entering and immediately begins acti coach-like, SHOUTING instruction, CLAPPING encouragement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE NOW SEE who has entered: Mrs. Jean du Pont. She's WHEE in by an attendant; another wheels the oxygen tank she's attached to. They park themselves by the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT: Mark SPRINTS through the woods, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK IN THE GYM: The wrestlers notice Jean, begin to stop what they're doing. Du Pont BLOWS HIS WHISTLE too loudly-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And.... break! Gentlemen, well done! Listen up. Team. Listen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several wrestlers GLANCE toward Dave to check his reactio this. Dave NODS his head in du Pont's direction.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A number of you will be travelling with me to the Olympic Trials in Pensacola next week. From the moment you leave these hallowed training grounds, you will be in competition. There's no lying in a fight. Who you think you are in the moments leading up to a fight, and who you are when the fight begins - the truth will become abundantly clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean du Pont watches her son.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Raul Garcia, come up here for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves. He gestures at Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Raul. Gecko. Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters under his breath) My fucking name's Roberto, dickweed. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springer smiles. Garcia stands. He's clearly the SMALLEST WRESTLER in the room. He approaches du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT: Mark sprinting through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muchas gracias, compadre. (gestures to the mat) Por favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcia gets in the down position. Du Pont kneels next to his arms hovering over him, not yet grabbing on.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The period begins before the whistle blows, when the other wrestler feels you above him, feels your purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean watches her son, not betraying any emotion.

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then... the whistle blows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont grabs onto Garcia. Tries to flip him. He can't mo him at all. TOTAL SILENCE, except for Du Pont grunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Du Pont, stoic - watches her son. Then she signals t her attendant to take her away. She's wheeled out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont sees her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave wrestles. He's having trouble with a younger wrestle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stretches by the wall, alone, trying to concentrate his upcoming match. He keeps glancing over at his struggl brother, and at du Pont in Dave's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont FANS Dave with a towel in between periods, "coach him", giving "advice". He's BEING FILMED BY A CAMERA CREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of Dave's match. Mark watches the ref raise the other wrestler's hand. Mark's stunned. 75.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (OVER P.A.)
dialogues.text: That's the second - and final - loss for David Schultz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave graciously HUGS the other wrestler. ON MARK, watchin devastated,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's on the mat, battling a college wrestler, Rico Chipparelli. Mark's struggling. We see a vulnerability we haven't seen before - something lost or disoriented. Dave shouts from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get after him, Mark! Shoot low!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont, BEING FILMED, claps, calls out instruction -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need to get after him, there. Low low low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In between periods, Mark sits in the chair in his corner while Dave gets in his face, coaching. But all Mark can p attention to is du Pont clumsily FANNING him with a towel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's open to the left. He leaves his entire left side open. You gotta get after that fucker! Make him pay. Now or never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's back out on the mat. It's not working. Mark gets PINNED. The wrestlers stand. The ref holds both of their hands, RAISES Chipparelli's arm. He turns them around, ra Chipparelli's arm again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks off the mat. Dave tries to console him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double elimination, buddy. You'll get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, Mark. A good effort. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks right past them, off the mats. We TRAIL him, staying with him as he walks straight out the arena door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks out the door and along the side of the buildin He turns down a side entrance ramp for delivery trucks leading down to an underground garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's alone here. He BANGS his head against the cement w smashing it repeatedly. He screams at himself. He punches himself. Punishment for losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, still in his wrestling clothes, sits on the edge of bed in front of a ROOM SERVICE CART loaded with food. His face is bloody. He gorges himself on fried chicken, sandwiches, french fries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's on his knees at the room MINI-BAR, having discover the Kit-Kat's, M&Ms. TV's on, place is a wreck. A KNO the door. LOUDER. Mark looks through the peephole. His PO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up - I know you're in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. I'm gonna kick it in if you don't open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave POUNDS hard, seriously rattling the doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark doesn't move. Dave starts to KICK IN the door - once twice - it might break. Mark goes to the door and opens i SILENCE as the brothers stand there looking at each other 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with you? You got a match in four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks away, sits on the bed. Dave comes in, surveys room - dishes on the room-service cart, open mini-bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, tell me you didn't eat all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to weigh in before every match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. I'm done. You lost. I lost. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks over to Mark, and CUFFS him, hard, on the side the head. He hits him again. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. Look at me. You have a chance to do what no wrestler's done since 1904. Not one. If you think I'm gonna let you throw away a chance to win back-to-back Olympic golds you're fucking crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave CUFFS him again, harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I'd give to have the extra years you've got? To have one more shot? To not have to start coaching full time? Do you?! (hits him again) I'm done, Mark. I've lost a step. You haven't. I will kick the shit out of you. I will lift you up and personally throw you out on that mat to take what's yours - what we've been training for since high school. And I will be on your ass every day from here to South Korea. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is silent, his face reddening. Staring straight ahea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you, Mark. You're not in this alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then, Mark stands and the CAMERA follows him int the bathroom. As he sticks his fingers down his throat an leans over the toilet bowl to throw up,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark steps on the scale. Dave watches. The balance shoots making a metallic clank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official MOVES the slide weight up from 82 KILOS to..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 kilos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does he have to make weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official glances up at the CLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weigh-in period ends at 3:30pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods. Grabs Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, fat boy, you got 90 minutes to cut 12 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark PEDALS furiously on a STATIONARY BIKE, wearing five layers of sweats and fleeces with PLASTICS on top. We can how much Mark is perspiring by the POOLS OF SWEAT which a collecting up his arms. Dave eggs him on as he shoves TIN PIECES of ICE up Mark's nose to keep him from overheating 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont walks in the far side, clapping, calling out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are. I've been looking all over for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave immediately trots over to du Pont, heading him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE their conversation from Mark's POV (we'll hear onl pieces of it): Dave explains how Mark needs to be left al Du Pont resists at first; Dave is gentle but firm. He tel du Pont he shouldn't be in Mark's corner right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, du Pont turns and WALKS OUT. Dave turns back tow Mark. Mark puts his head down and PEDALS even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U on the CLOCK: 3:29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weigh-in official CLOSES his log book. Dave and Mark BURST into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! We're here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official looks at them, OPENS his log book. Dave help Mark peel off his sweats. Soaked, they hit the floor with smack. Mark, in his singlet, gets on the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's 30 GRAMS OVERWEIGHT (5 ounces). He steps off, and Da helps PEEL his singlet off. He gets back on the scale nak The official slides the weight bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 GRAMS OVER. Dave grabs Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his wallet from his sweats pocket and pulls out CREDIT CARD, dropping the wallet on the floor. Dave SQUEE sweat off Mark's naked body with the card. Scraping him d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps Mark back on the scale. The pointer bobs, finall reaches equilibrium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 kilos. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark practically COLLAPSES. Dave helps him off the scale, walks him over to a bench, sits him down. He grabs a GATO from nearby table and hold it out to Mark, who looks like might pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. Drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark just sits there. Not taking the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark SLAMS his opponent, Mike Sheets, to the mat. He's li an animal, dominating, aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave coaches from Mark's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF QUICK CUTS OF MARK'S MATCHES: Mark dominating turning his opponents, taking them down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEN: The END WHISTLE of Mark's final match. The wrestler stand and the referee RAISES MARK'S ARM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's EXULTANT - leaping and screaming onto the mat - he grabs his brother in a BEAR HUG and LIFTS him off the mat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dave joyfully carries his exhausted, victorious brothe around the mat, he glances over at where du Pont would be sitting. Empty seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks down the long hall checking door numbers. He s to KNOCK on one. After a moment, Stan Beck opens the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stan. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having some trouble finding John. He's not in his room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I wanted to check in with him. I had a kind of uncomfortable thing with John before the match this afternoon - Mark was in a really delicate place, and I had to ask John to not be in his corner. I just wanted to make sure he's okay with everything. And that he's happy with the result. With how things turned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave. Mr. du Pont's mother died this morning. He flew home to Philadelphia earlier today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Dave, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan's "All the Tired Horses" STARTS TO PLAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All the Tired Horses" PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U on Jean du Pont's face in an OIL PAINTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS of her horse-jumping ribbons; PHOTOS of Jean riding the space John cleared for his wrestlers' MEDALS; John's Masters' Tournament winner's PLAQUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT of the POSTER of Mark oiled-up, hanging on the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERY WIDE SHOT of the field between the Main House and th stables. A distant figure - tall, thin - makes his way ac the field. "All the Tired Horses" PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to the stables are wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All the Tired Horses" PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses peer out from their stalls, confused, wild-eye Du Pont goes from stall to stall, throwing open the gates waves the horses out, slapping them, waving his arms, shouting wildly, forcing the horses outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All the Tired Horses" PLAYS. The horses CHARGE OUT from stables and onto the fields. Du Pont follows them out, wa at them drunkenly, falling, getting up, falling again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's Subaru turns off the road, onto the main driveway Foxcatcher. Nancy's driving, Dave next to her, Mark in th back seat. A GUARD emerges from a makeshift guardhouse ne the entrance gates to stop them. Nancy rolls down window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning across Nancy) What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We live here. We're part of Team Foxcatcher. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New security plan. Names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Nancy Schultz. Mark Schultz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see some picture ID's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hand over their driver's licences. Mark reaches to h his over from the back seat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - this guy just made the Olympic team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. The Guard takes the ID's into the guardhouse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks out his window: patrolling the roof of the mai house, we can see PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GUARDS. One of th speaks into a microphone in his cuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard returns. Hands back their ID's. And hands Dave ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark lifts his duffel bag from the back of Dave's car. He comes around to Dave's open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning? 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick you up tomorrow, 7am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark starts off, then turns quickly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - your house, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave has to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats, my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mark walks into the Chalet, he looks over toward the B House, where he can see a SECURITY DETAIL fanned out on t lawn, sweeping the ground with metal detectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CAR: Dave looks down at envelope in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens it. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John wrote me a check for ten thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as du Pont trudges across the lawn toward the F House in Foxcatcher sweats. After a few moments, he's followed by a LARGE PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GUARD in a dark suit... and by Stan Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrestlers warm up, work out, lift weights. Dave and Mark train intensively together, doing TAKE-DOWN DRILLS. Mark executes, Dave murmurs instruction to Mark, they do the d again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont WALKS IN THE GYM, trailed by the his Plainclothes Security Guard and Stan. Du Pont looks like he hasn't showered in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave moves toward John, offering greetings and condolence "How you doing there, Coach," "Sorry to hear about your mother, sir," etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont brushes off the offers of sympathy -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no. All's fine. There's work to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to work, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they go back to their drills, John stays on the perime watching Mark, STARING at them. It's disconcerting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave moves back to work with Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. Focus. Look at me. (Mark looks at him) Focus on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's run it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark tries to run the takedown, Dave escapes, he spins on Mark and takes him down hard. As they stand up, Dave smac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your head on straight and do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont walks over. Mark can barely look at him. Du Pont stops close to Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks to Dave to save him from this. Dave's clearly caught in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks down, closes his eyes as if in pain. Du Pont m close to Dave, speaking to him so Mark can hear - 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you and I can't get him there, no one can. We're in this together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long moment, du Pont moves off the mat. He starts stretch nearby. As Dave tries to get Mark back to work, d Pont starts to JOG around the perimeter of the gym. Mark' trying to keep it together, but it's clearly driving him insane. As du Pont jogs and jogs -

dialogues.speaker: DU PONT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Our challenge... as coaches... as leaders. I have coached... and psychologically prepare... Our Mark Schultz. To capture Olympic Gold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U of du Pont. HE'S SPEAKING DIRECTLY TO CAMERA. We're n sure where we are yet. He speaks haltingly, with effort, trying to be authoritative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I wear many hats. I am leader. Mentor. Father figure. Brother. Older brother. At times the younger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a WIDER ANGLE, we see that he's being FILMED for the documentary. He wears his Foxcatcher sweat jacket with HE COACH and JOHN `Eagle' du PONT" stitched onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will not be easy. We have built... our family. Our obligation... is to build... winners... In life. To teach the secret... To build men who will... think of... Who will understand... the character traits... We must teach them... whether they will listen or no. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's finished. Silence. He stares steadily into the camer Then he twitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY TEAM taps on the outside of the main house, li to the walls with what look like giant STETHOSCOPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CHALET: A HORSE, its mane unkempt and knotted, eats g in the side yard. Lifting its head, it noses the side win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRED COLE, with TWO OTHER OFFICIALS from USA WRESTLING, s across from du Pont's desk. Dave's there, as is Stan Beck John sits at his desk, CLEANING and OILING his pistol. A glass of SCOTCH next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're so very sorry about your mother's passing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont doesn't look up, just meticulously cleans each pa of the gun. Almost mumbling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Very sad. Very sad days here. Here at the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps his focus on the disassembled gun, wiping clean piece. Silence, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whatever we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we wanted to discuss... Mr. Du Pont spends a significant amount of money for wrestlers' training here at Foxcatcher. Now - in addition - he'd like to make a sizable direct donation to USA Wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This money would come with conditions.

dialogues.speaker: STAN BECK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First: that you will start to offer Foxcatcher Farms - with the Golden Eagle as Head Coach, and Dave Schultz as Coach - as an alternative to Colorado Springs for wrestlers to train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask what sort of a donation we're discussing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred chokes on his glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: STAN BECK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Second: that the du Pont family name be on all Olympic wrestling singlets and sweatsuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) And gym bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And gym bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Fred glances at his fellow officials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sprints through the woods, breathing hard. He emerge from the ring of trees onto the lawn near the Big House. immediately brought up short as SEVERAL SECURITY GUARDS c towards him, hands up --

dialogues.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir! Please turn around and go back the way you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Security. Please turn around and go back the way you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the guard, Mark can see a SECURITY DETAIL fanned o around the perimeter of the Big House. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -?

dialogues.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: - We'll let you know when this area is open. Please turn around and go back the way you came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's confused, still breathing hard. After a moment, he turns and walks off into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We believe that Eagle has earned the right to be named to the official roster of Olympic coaches at Seoul. Which means he would be in Mark Schultz's corner throughout the games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred looks over at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll all, of course, just need to get him to sign off on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take care of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and the other wrestlers warm up, stretch, run drills

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks into the gym in streetclothes, stays near the entrance. Dave senses that something's going on with his brother, walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in the Big House yesterday? 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the afternoon? Because I got turned away when I came within fifty yards of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a coach here. I get paid by John. I was meeting with John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. Get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's weakening me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Bachman at SMU last night. He says they're expanding the program. There'll be room for both of us in the fall -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Mark -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I told him we could all get on the phone next weekend -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - You need to focus on what's happening a month from now. Not -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - SMU's gonna make a move, they're gonna take a run at it - we can be there at the beginning -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Don't do this. Don't do it. Stay clear about what we're working for. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I can't do this anymore. I can't do it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - It's not the time, Mark -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - John's killing me here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - He's not killing you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - If we at least let Bachman know by the end of the week we'll have a place to go to after -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Stop. Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat as Dave looks at Mark. As gently as he can:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will make sure you're taken care of after Seoul. I'll talk to John - whatever you decide: you want to stay, you want to go - I'll make sure you're taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's looking at his brother, something dawning on him f the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking of staying here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mark. The schools are great, the kids are happy. They have eight hundred acres to run around in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's at a complete loss. Just when he'd reconnected wit his brother, it seems they'll be separated again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you win next month you're in a class by yourself, you write your own ticket. You live your own life however you want. Focus on that. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be here. Whenever you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark seems lost. Dave pats him on the shoulder and turns walk toward his office. Mark watches him walk away, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your forehead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To remind me to pick up the kids from school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? When are you gonna you see your own forehead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to. You just told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Mark, PRELAP:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, sir. Five tons of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An M-113 Armored Personnel Carrier (APC) is off-loaded fr the back of a wide-load army trailer. A DELIVERY CORPORAL directs the operation. Du Pont watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one beautiful vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CORPORAL watches du Pont climb atop the APC. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the grenade launcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 40mm grenade launcher that's supposed to be mounted up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corporal pages through the sheets of his delivery ord

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir. I don't... I don't see anything in the order -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - It goes right here. Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it does. It does mount right there on the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORKERS heighten and reinforce the PERIMETER FENCE that r along the rural roads surrounding the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Portions of the exterior brick-face have been opened up, SECURITY EXPERTS are peering inside, snaking cameras thro the walls... looking for... something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drizzling. Du Pont sits in the M-113 APC, his torso stick out the top. He TURNS IT ON, the engine roaring to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is being interviewed for the documentary. He stands his workout clothes, in front of the camera crew. Some of wrestlers work out behind him. Dave's reading much of wha says from CUE CARDS held near the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Dave Schultz. I'm Coach and head of recruiting here at Foxcatcher, under Head Coach John "Eagle" du Pont -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's voice continues -

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: - Coach du Pont, uh, understands excellence, he represents... excellence, he expects it from his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont drives the APC over a little ridge and starts dow long slope toward the POND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (halting; trying so hard) - His... commitment to this sport is complete. He's made himself um, an... an expert in the sport of wrestling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, who's been so good at playing along, takes it too f even for himself. As he says the next bit, he stumbles ov his words -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eagle is indispensable to - uh - what it... to - what we're trying to accomplish here. (looks down,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We... consider John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont drives the APC down the slope, into the POND. He continues driving as the tank goes lower and lower in the water -- the water covers the vehicle, then his torso, hi neck, his head. And he's gone. Completely submerged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Beat. The surface of the water is still. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont BREAKS the surface. He looks around, then swims slowly to shore. The tank remains on the bottom of the po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Mark sit on the couch across from Stan Beck and Pont. Dave is firm and clear, but entirely diplomatic. Du Pont looks dishevelled, he won't meet anyone's gaze. We c see the POSTER of Mark hanging on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll commit to remaining at Foxcatcher so long as John wants me here, but only if my brother is taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken care of how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long as I'm here, Mark will continue to be paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paid what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His full salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want him paid even if he leaves? What if he quits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether or not he chooses to stay. That's right. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan's incredulous. He glances over at du Pont, but his b doesn't make eye contact. Stan turns back to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making quite an assumption about the value of your presence here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to test the theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see how many wrestlers stay if I decide to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it doesn't come to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd also ask John to understand the delicate nature of the lead-up to Seoul, and please allow Mark some space. Let him train just with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont winces at this, but keeps quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're that determined to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd like the option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan leans over to du Pont and WHISPERS in his ear. It go on for several seconds. Finally, du Pont NODS very slight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, Mark has always been free to train in whatever -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - That's not exactly how it's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Just a minute - you've had your say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - To train in whatever way is most effective for him. Eagle offers his advice and counsel. If Mark chooses to ignore it, that's his loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. du Pont would be prepared to accept your financial terms, but only if we get an answer to what we proposed weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That John du Pont, Head Coach of Team Foxcatcher, be seated in Mark's corner throughout the Olympic Games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark looks at Dave. Quiet, betrayed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've talked about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was waiting for the right moment to bring it up with you. You haven't exactly been in a receptive frame of mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Then Mark shrugs, and looks away from his brother. He's given up fighting this fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then. I guess we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as they all just sit there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U on Mark, in his wrestling gear, looking disoriented, unfocused. He's in the hall right outside the locker room just steps away from the WRESTLING ARENA. Dave's in his f talking to him INTENSELY over the sounds of the crowd ins 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your moment to prove yourself - your moment to step out alone, away from everyone, into the spotlight. This has nothing to do with me, nothing to do with John -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont hovers a few feet behind Dave, being filmed by hi CAMERA CREW. Mark's eyes keep glancing over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - nothing to do with anyone but you. This is you, Mark. This is you. Focus and take what's yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark stands in his corner on the edge of the mat, flanked Dave and du Pont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the United States of America, at 82 kilos... Mark Schultz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks onto the mat. CHANTS of "U.S.A... U.S.A..." fr the Americans in the stands... waving flags and shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark faces his Bulgarian opponent in the center of the ma each are checked by the REFEREE. As Mark is patted down, glances over at his corner: du Pont is talking in Dave's and Dave HAS HIS ARM AROUND du Pont's shoulders, listenin The camera crew films them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrestle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's immediately taken down, for a moment ONTO HIS BACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark is GASPING for air, sitting in his chair in the corn Dave rubs his muscles while yelling at him, in his face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mark can only focus on du Pont, clumsily fanning him the white towel, accidentally hitting him with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark wrestles, struggling - eyes lost, mouth open, gaspin The drive, the poetry, it's all gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REFEREE blows the whistle. The match is over. The wrestle stand. Referee RAISES THE BULGARIAN'S hand. Mark looks lo Du Pont is STARING at him. Dave hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ref turns the wrestlers around and raises the Bulgarian's hand again. Du Pont watches the small Bulgarian contingen the crowd - cheering, dancing, waving the Bulgarian flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U on Mark. He's driving. We don't know where he is, whe he's driving. CAMERA stays close on him for some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark turns a RYDER VAN onto the Foxcatcher estate. He sto at the GUARDHOUSE, in front of the mechanical arm which blocks his way. The guard slides open the guardhouse wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Mark, looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks out of the house, arms full of belongings, pas pile of crap he's leaving heaped on the porch. He tosses things in the back of the van, slams the doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV from THIRD FLOOR WINDOW OF THE BIG HOUSE: Mark drivin his van away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE SHOT: We see who's POV this is: John du Pont, watching from his third floor window. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DU PONT'S POV: Mark's Ryder van drives toward the front g toward the guard house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark drives past it... and off the estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE: Du Pont, in the window, closes the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birds sit in the BARE BRANCHES of an oak tree; THREE HORS long-haired and un-groomed, paw at the snowy ground, look for grass; the American FLAG hangs limply on the flagpole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS: The EMPTY ROOMS of the Foxcatcher Big House. Former grandeur, now devoid of life, dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER the last of these shots, WE HEAR a DEEP, OVERLY DRAM VOICE coming from a TV:

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... He's coached national and world champions with his unique blend of passion and inspiration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U of a TV SCREEN: a SERIES OF IMAGES: Mark Schultz winn matches (one of the images is the one that became the Foxcatcher poster); Dave winning; Dan Bane winning.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEN, on screen, is the scene of du Pont "teaching" Mark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the under hook, pivot sideways while pulling down on his arm. Kneel between his legs and take him to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark lets du Pont take him down, though it's abundantly apparent how much Mark is gritting his teeth through this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE where we are: a huge empty room - once used for gr dances. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a corner: du Pont and the Documentary Director sit on chairs in front of a TV hooked up to a VCR. The Director screening "The John du Pont Story" for his boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont has a PISTOL tucked in his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE VIDEO: A SHOT OF: Mark finding du Pont in the stan at the Worlds and hugging him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT OF: Mark winning the Olympic Trials and Dave HUGGI and LIFTING his brother into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT OF: du Pont watching this from the stands and rais his fist in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT OF: Dave talking to the camera in the Foxcatcher g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's made himself an - an expert in the art and sport of wrestling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stumbles on the words -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eagle is indispensable to - uh - what it... what we're trying to accomplish here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks down, obviously uncomfortable -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We... consider John... one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT OF: du Pont talking to the camera, haltingly - try so hard to be authoritative, inspirational:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our challenge... as coaches... as leaders. I have coached... and psychologically prepare... our Mark Schultz... to capture Olympic Gold. I wear many hats. I am leader. Mentor. Father figure. Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT of a GOLDEN EAGLE sitting on a tree branch, then flying away.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The symbol of America is the Golden Eagle... 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT of du Pont climbing into the pilot seat of his helicopter. He puts on his headset.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John du Pont is that Golden Eagle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont takes off in the helicopter and flies away. Over shot, the end title comes up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAPE ENDS. The TV screen goes to static snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. Du Pont sits there, Director next to him. Finall du Pont stands and starts for the door. Director follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've bought several time slots next week on local station WPHI -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Several late night slots, of course, but there was also an open afternoon half-hour, directly after "The Edge of Night." That should be a good one -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont continues right out the door, down the hallway, n even turning to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Director stops at the door. He calls out to du Pont -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I'll let you know what the viewership numbers are as soon as I have them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont walks out a SIDE DOOR of the Big House, followed the LARGE PLAINCLOTHES SECURITY GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues toward his car - the BLACK MERCURY - goes to driver's side. Then, something catches his eye in a nearb tree - he points it out the Security Guard: 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northern Cardinal. Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never leave home, no matter how cold it gets.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in the car and du Pont turns on the ignition. Be he shifts into gear, he removes the PISTOL from his waist and places it on the middle seat. He pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont drives the dirt road that edges the woods ringing enormous front lawn. The trees are bare, a bit snowy. Peaceful and pretty. The car approaches Dave's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont's car pulls up. Dave's Subaru is parked in the ya out front, and Dave lies half-in-half-out the driver's si door, working on the FUSE BOX under the steering column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave rises out of the car to see who's pulled up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave takes a step toward du Pont's car. Du Pont just look him through his open driver's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont picks up his PISTOL from the seat.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Oh. Hold on there -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont POINTS the pistol at Dave. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave holds out his hand - on his palm is the word "KIDS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont SHOOTS Dave. The bullet goes through Dave's hand, smashing into his chest, throwing him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard scrambles out the car door and ducks behind the passenger side fender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave tries to crawl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave!.... David!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy runs onto the porch and is screaming for her husban

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont POINTS the pistol at her. She RUNS inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du Pont SHOOTS Dave in the back. Then he SHOOTS him in th back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few moments, he drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy runs outside. She cradles her husband as he bleeds in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, his HEAD SHAVED, sits in a chair too small for him. He's in front of a painted cinder block wall. He wears on shorts, no shirt. A CLOCK ticks on the wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After several moments, we START TO HEAR crowd-pumping MUS in the background. LOUDER. LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark walks out of the tunnel into the ARENA. HUGE SOUND - loud, crowd-pumping music. Strobe lights. Mark's bare- chested, no shoes. He looks straight ahead as he walks. There's something missing behind his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark fights a Japanese martial artist. Mark's destroying in a brutal, uninhibited display of aggression. He's got opponent on his back and he pounds his bloody face repeat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REF stops the fight. Mark stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's completely still, except for his heavy breathing. Th other man's blood is on him. The crowd is wild, CHANTING,
